Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit a fifty and Shivam Dube finished things off with a drive down the ground!
Arshdeep Singh took four wickets for nine runs
India win the toss and will field!
Wicket! Rohit c Harmeet b Netravalkar 3 (India 10-2)
Wicket! Virat Kohli c Gous b Netravalkar 0 (India 1-1)
Wicket! Jasdeep run-out (Pant/Siraj) 2 USA 110-8 after 20 overs
Wicket! Harmeet c Pant b Arshdeep 10 (USA 98-7)
Wicket! Anderson c Pant b Hardik 15 (USA 96-6)
Pre-Game Insights: India qualified for the Super Eight stage of the T20 World Cup with a seven-wicket win over the United States
India win the toss and will field!
The US, second in Group A with four points after suffering their first loss in three matches, will also ensure qualification for the next round if they beat Ireland on Friday
Pakistan and the USA hang on run-rate equations. USA play Ireland on Friday, Pakistan play Ireland on Sunday
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Jones: “I would say we were 10-15 runs short, if we got 125, 130 it would be a tough total. I think the boys were pretty disciplined, it was really pleasing to me to take the boys so close.”

Rohit Sharma: “We knew it was going to be a tough task, we lost some wickets early. Lot of these guys [USA team] we played cricket together and I’m very happy to see their progress in cricket, they’re going from strength to strength and I wish nothing but the best for them. We know that the bowlers have to take the lead but they all did the job, particularly Arsheep. It is a big relief to be into the Super Eights, playing cricket here wasn’t easy, could have been anyone’s game – luckily for us we managed to pull through in all three games.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube steadied the innings and got India over the line with 10 balls to spare
Arshdeep Singh celebrated his first ball dismissal of Shayan Jahangir
India’s Arshdeep Singh celebrates the dismissal of United States’ Harmeet Singh (left), his fourth wicket of the innings
The pitch dictated that New Yorkers wouldn’t be watching big-hitting six-fests, but there were some real humdingers nonetheless
The US, second in Group A with four points after suffering their first loss in three matches, will also ensure qualification for the next round if they beat Ireland on Friday
India joined Australia and South Africa in the Super Eight stage
Others: The pitch was described as the lowest-scoring ground in T20 WC history
The stadium announcer declared the score with huge enthusiasm which, I think, they do after every over
The game was played in New York
The match was the final game in the New York stadium
